page.title: 05FARMING PEDIGREE FREISIANS.
page.content: Every pedigree herd has its own prefix, which is a name that goes before the cow's name. Our prefix is Cockleton. When a cow calves her calf must be registered within thirty days. This means sending details of the calf to the Friesian Society. They send back its registration certificate and herd book number which it has for life. The conformation of the cows is very important to the pedigree breeder and he is always trying to improve the cows, which are classified every year into six grades. The best is excellent and the worst is poor. The aim is to breed cows that give a lot of milk and can win shows, like the cow who gave 13000kg. in one lactation, winning the dairy farming event and being sold for 32,000 guineas.
